questions.text: what city is Mary sent to after her parents die?
who are the two women who are assigned to take care of Mary in her uncle's absence?
what famous park does Mary visit when she first arrives in the city?
Ben owns a special kind of corner store that is called what?
at the bodega, who does Ben say doesn't usually like customers to pet him but seems to like Mary?
what type of plant does Ben gift Mary at the bodega?
what exhibits at the Museum of Natural History does Ben recommend Mary should see?
what memory makes Mary begin to cry as she is visiting the Museum of Natural History?
questions.answer: She remembers looking at fish with her family when she sees a family looking at fish in the aquarium

questions.text: Mary visits the MET and finds out about what famous Impressionist painter who liked to paint pictures of a particular bridge?
Mary finds a key in a drawer that helps her unlock the door to the rooftop where she finds what?
who does Martha invite over to help Mary bring the garden back to life?
who used to take care of the rooftop garden before he died?
when Mary's Uncle Archie offers to get her something she wants, what does she ask for?
Mary hears noises on the floor above her and she later finds out those noises were made by her cousin whose first and last name is what?
readers discover that Colin has what type of disorder?
what flower do readers discover through Mary's social media is the earliest to bloom?
Dickon points out that "normal" is not a word that he would like to use and that he instead thinks of the three of them (himself, Mary, and Colin) as what?
when Colin is sharing good memories of his dad in the garden, Mary starts to cry and tells Colin it is because of what?
questions.answer: Because she fears she does not have any good memories to hang onto of her parents

questions.text: readers discover from Mary's social media that what type of bud is edible?
Colin says that he "forgets to feel scared" since he has been doing what?
what does Colin plant for Robin the cat?
who do Colin, Mary, and Dickon show the garden to first?
Mary has a good memory of her parents and especially of her mom reading to her that took place where?
what type of plant does Ben bring to plant in the garden that Masahiro always wanted?
questions.answer: A rose (specifically a Don Juan climbing rose)

questions.text: at the end, Uncle Archie assures Mary that he, Colin, and Mary are all going to be what?
do two friends and eventually a third friend revive a garden?
does a girl's parents die so she is sent to live with her uncle in New York City?
is a boy diagnosed with panic disorder and lives a life mainly in his room until he meets his cousin Mary?
does a girl become a part of a new family that includes her uncle and her cousin?
is there a special kind of cat called a "bodega cat"?
